intro: Dissochaeta calothyrsa, commonly known as the silky hairbush, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its soft, hairy foliage and showy yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
